title: The Only Four Fund Combinations You Need for Investing
subtitle: Streamline Your Portfolio with These Simple Strategies
content:
The Only Four Fund Combinations You Need for Investing

I'm Tyler, I'm a former financial advisor and portfolio manager, and now I make financial content for free so you don't have to pay for it.

1. For Your 20s and 30s

Invest in one fund: VUG, Vanguard's Growth ETF. This means 100% stocks, zero bonds. You have a 30 plus year time horizon; volatility does not matter.

2. For Your 40s and 50s

Use two funds: VTI, Vanguard Total Stock Market and BND, Vanguard's Total Bond Market. We add bonds for stability because the closer you get to needing the money, the more you might need bonds. Think timeline, not age.

3. For Global Diversification

If you're worried the US won't dominate forever, use three funds: VTI plus VXUS, Vanguard's International Stock ETF plus BND. This gives you global diversification without added complexity. An example allocation could be 70% VTI, 20% VXUS, and 10% BND - done!

4. For Added Sophistication

If you want more sophistication (which you donâ€™t need), use four or five funds. This would include VTI plus BND plus VXUS plus one or two of either VNQ, Vanguard's Real Estate Trust Index, GLD, or cryptocurrency like BTC. Keep this part under 10% combined. Most people do not need this added complexity, but if you want non-correlation and like to talk about your portfolio at dinner parties, this is your answer.
